page.title: 01SARRATT
page.content: The Parish of Sarratt is rural.Quiet, peaceful farming country covers most of this area.It's boundaries stretch from the River Gade near Watford's Cassiobury Park west to the River Chess near Chorleywood.The main centre of population is Sarratt but the hamlets in the parish include Bucks Hill,Belsize,Church End,Micklefield Green and Chandlers Cross.Commonwood and Chipperfield are also included in Sarratt's village policeman's administration.The main features of Sarratt are it's wide village green,it's characteristic pubs,it's ancient church,a popular garden centre,and a picturesque duck pond.The amenities include a telephone box,a post office,a doctor and vets surgery, and a village hall.There is a garage, two general stores,a newsagents,an antique shop,and a hardware/wool shop.
